thread.title: What channel is Chicago Cubs-New York Mets on? TV, live stream for NLCS Game 2
thread.title_full: What channel is Chicago Cubs-New York Mets on? TV, live stream for NLCS Game 2 | syracuse.com

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: What channel is Chicago Cubs-New York Mets on? TV, live stream for NLCS Game 2
text:
The New York Mets will host the Chicago Cubs in Game 2 of their National League Championship Series on Saturday night at Citi Field.
New York grabbed a 1-0 lead in the best-of-7 series by taking Game 1 4-2 on Friday.
Tonight's game will feature another prime pitching matchup: Chicago's Jake Arietta against New York's Noah Syndergaard.
The game starts at 8 p.m. and will be televised by TBS. Here's how to find TBS in Central New York:
Time Warner: Channel 104 (SD & HD) and channel 17 for non-digital customers Verizon Fios: Channel 552 (HD) and 52 (SD) DirectTV: Channel 247 (SD & HD) Dish Network: Channel 139 (SD &HD) New Visions: Channel 673 (HD) and 126 (SD) You can also watch online or through tablets and mobile devices using Watch TBS .
Radio
The game can be heard locally on ESPN 97.7/100.1-FM and AM-1200.
